original:
Prior to the arrival of European explorers, Native Hawaiians did not possess metal tools or woven cloth. Despite this, traditional Hawaiian art forms have continued to thrive. Following the arrival of Captain James Cook in 1778, some craftsmen have maintained the production of traditional Hawaiian arts, either for sale to tourists or to preserve the native culture.
